caption: Table 1: The teacher policies corresponding to the three approaches for UED. U(Θ) is a uniform distribution over environment parameter space, D„ is a baseline distribution, „ is the trajectory which maximizes regret of π, and υπ is the value above the baseline distribution that π achieves on that trajectory, cr is the negative of the worst-case regret of π. Details are described in PAIRED [3].
description: This table summarizes the teacher policies used in three different Unsupervised Environment Design (UED) approaches: Domain Randomization (DR), PAIRED, and the proposed SHED method.  It shows the teacher's policy (Λ(π)) and decision rule for each approach.  The notation U(Θ) represents a uniform distribution over the environment parameter space;  Ď represents a baseline distribution; θπ represents the environment parameter that maximizes the regret of the student policy (π); and υπ is the student's performance above the baseline distribution.
section: 3.3 Rewards and Choice of evaluate environments
